description: Removal of BT kiosk(s) and replacement with 1no. new InLink structure offering free Wi-Fi
decision_conditions: The proposed development by virtue of its size and siting would result in a visually intrusive and incongruous addition to the street scene that would compete with existing street furniture and sign age creating street clutter and detract from the character and appearance of the area and would fail to preserve or enhance the character and appearance of the Surbiton Town Centre Conservation Area. It is considered that the proposed development would be harmful to the Conservation Area, albeit less than substantial, however, this harm is not outweighed by any public benefits. The proposal would not accord with section 72 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and policies CS8, DM10 and DM12 of the Council's adopted LDF Core Strategy April 2012 and guidance / policy in the National Planning Policy Framework.

Condition 12 (Sustainable Drainage) - The RBK Flood Risk Officer has reviewed the information provided and is satisfied that Condition 12 of planning permission 16/13050/FUL can now be fully approved.

Please revise and resubmit a copy of an Ordnance Survey based site location plan scaled 1:1250 with the application site outlined in red.Please note that this is not clear on the submitted plan and seem to differ to our records.
